Main tumhe ready-to-paste professional command de raha hoon

Windsurf AI ke liye Command

sql
I am building a React Native (Expo) app named "Sneply".

Google Login is not working.
When I try to login, profile picture and user data are not appearing.
Sometimes nothing happens after clicking Google Sign-In.

Please:

1. Check if expo-auth-session or @react-native-google-signin/google-signin is configured properly.
2. Verify Google Cloud Console OAuth credentials.
3. Check if SHA-1 and SHA-256 keys are added.
4. Verify redirect URI configuration.
5. Fix profile data extraction (name, email, photo).
6. Add proper error handling and console logs.
7. Ensure Android and Web both work correctly.

After fixing:
- Show working Google login code.
- Ensure user photo, name and email display correctly.
- Make sure login state is stored using AsyncStorage.

Return full corrected working code.

Agar Expo use kar rahe ho to ye bhi bhejo:

csharp
Ensure Google login is implemented using expo-auth-session with proper client IDs:
- expoClientId
- androidClientId
- webClientId

Fix any misconfiguration and provide complete working example.

Important Check (Khud bhi dekh lo)

Google Login ka 90% issue inme se hota hai:

  • Google Cloud Console me OAuth client create nahi kiya

  • SHA-1 add nahi kiya

  • Redirect URI galat

  • Android package name mismatch

  • Firebase connect nahi kiya

Agar tum chaho to:

Mujhe batao:

  • Expo use kar rahe ho ya React Native CLI?

  • Firebase use ho raha hai?

  • Error kya aa raha hai exactly?

Main Sneply ke liye direct working Google Login code bana dunga

Settings

Click Web icon </>

App nickname: Sneply

Step 3: Firebase Config Copy karo

Tumhe aisa code milega:

js
const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: "XXXXXXXX",
  authDomain: "XXXXXXXX",
  projectId: "XXXXXXXX",
  storageBucket: "XXXXXXXX",
  messagingSenderId: "XXXXXXXX",
  appId: "XXXXXXXX"
};

Step 4: Apne Project Me Replace karo

Sneply folder me:

Search karo file:

firebase.js

ya

firebaseConfig.js

Waha jo dummy values hain unko replace karo real Firebase values se.

Authentication
Sign-in method

Email/Password

mathematica

Akshu
Mil gaya problem

Tumhara Signup button ka function ye hai:

ts
const navigateToSignup = () => {
  // This would navigate to signup screen
  console.log('Navigate to signup');
};

Matlab navigation ho hi nahi raha
Sirf console log ho raha hai.

Ab Exact Fix (2 Minute)

Step 1 Navigation Import karo

File ke top me add karo:

ts
import { useNavigation } from '@react-navigation/native';

Step 2 Navigation Hook use karo

Component ke andar add karo:

ts
const navigation = useNavigation();

To tumhara starting part aisa ho jayega:

ts
export default function LoginScreen() {
  const navigation = useNavigation();

Step 3 navigateToSignup change karo

Replace this:

ts
const navigateToSignup = () => {
  console.log('Navigate to signup');
};

With this:

ts
const navigateToSignup = () => {
  navigation.navigate('Signup' as never);
};

Save karo

Phir browser refresh karo.

SignupScreen open ho jayegi

Akshu
Ab jo screenshot me dikh raha hai ye runtime crash nahi hai.
Ye sirf TypeScript / lint error indicator (red underline) hai.

Main zoom karke dekha

Red underline hai:

makefile
creatorName:

Yaha issue hai 

ts
creatorName: {
  color: COLORS.secondary,
},

Problem ye hai ki upar already ek style object me:

ts
creatorName: {

use ho chuka hai earlier in file (room header section).

React Native StyleSheet me duplicate keys allowed nahi hote.

Problem

creatorName style name 2 jagah defined hai.

Ek upar:

ts
creatorName: {
  fontSize: 16,
  fontWeight: '700',
  color: COLORS.text,
}

Aur niche dubara:

ts
creatorName: {
  color: COLORS.secondary,
}

Isliye red error aa raha hai.

Fix (2 Second)

Niche wale ko rename karo.

Change this:

ts
creatorName: {
  color: COLORS.secondary,
},

To something like:

ts
creatorNameHighlight: {
  color: COLORS.secondary,
},

Aur jaha use ho raha hai:

Change:

ts
item.isCreator && styles.creatorName

To:

ts
item.isCreator && styles.creatorNameHighlight

Fir kya hoga?

Red error gayab
App stable
No crash

Developer Note

Ye common mistake hai jab:

  • Same style name copy paste hota hai

  • AI duplicate style bana deta hai

Akshu
Rename karke save karo
Red line gayi?

Ab Sneply clean ho raha hai

STEP 2 Android Package Name Set Karna

Play Store pe upload karne ke liye unique package name zaroori hota hai.

Example:

com.sneply.app

Ye har app ka unique ID hota hai.

Ab Ye Karo

  1. VS Code me app.json open karo

  2. Usme "expo" ke andar "android" section dhoondo

Agar "android" section nahi hai
to add karna padega.

Final Structure Aisa Hona Chahiye:

json
{
  "expo": {
    "name": "Sneply",
    "slug": "sneply",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "android": {
      "package": "com.sneply.app",
      "versionCode": 1
    }
  }
}

Important:

  • package unique hona chahiye

  • Future me change nahi kar sakte

  • Safe option: com.akshat.sneply

Agar chaho to better use karo:

com.akshat.sneply

Ye more professional lagega.

Ab clear bata deta hoon:

1 Forgot Password kyu kaam nahi kar raha?

Agar button hai lekin kaam nahi kar raha, to 3 reason ho sakte hain:

Reason 1

Code me sendPasswordResetEmail() function add nahi kiya

Reason 2

Firebase Authentication me Email/Password enabled hai (tumhare me hai )
Lekin app me reset logic connect nahi hai

Reason 3

Firestore / internet error ki wajah se request fail ho rahi

Solution (Code me ye hona chahiye)

js
import { sendPasswordResetEmail } from "firebase/auth";

await sendPasswordResetEmail(auth, email);
alert("Password reset email sent!");

Agar ye code nahi hai to button sirf design hai, kaam nahi karega.

2 Settings page kyu nahi hai?

Abhi tumhari app me:

  • Login

  • Signup

  • (shayad home)

  • Settings screen nahi

  • Logout button nahi

  • Profile update nahi

Ye sab manually banana padta hai Firebase automatically nahi deta.

3 Logout kaise add karte hain?

js
import { signOut } from "firebase/auth";

rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {

lua
rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {

  }
}

diff

STEP 3 Auto Login

Auto login ke liye app start par check hona chahiye:

javascript
onAuthStateChanged(auth, (user) => {
  if (user) {
    navigate("Home")
  } else {
    navigate("Login")
  }
})

Ye code agar app start me nahi hai to auto login kaam nahi karega.

Tum Windsurf ko bolo:

pgsql
Ensure app checks authentication state on startup using onAuthStateChanged.
If user exists, go to Home screen.
If not, go to Login screen.

STEP 4 Delete Account

Delete account ke liye:

scss
deleteUser(auth.currentUser)

Saath me Firestore se uska profile bhi delete hona chahiye:

less
deleteDoc(doc(db, "users", user.uid))

Windsurf ko bolo:

diff
Implement delete account feature:
- Delete Firebase Auth user
- Delete Firestore profile (users/{uid})
- Then logout and redirect to login screen
